channel.title: Interleaved RSS Feed
channel.description: This is an interleaved feed of the most recent entries from each RSS source, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: There’s No Sense of Shame at the Supreme Court
item.description: Congress and the judiciary can no longer allow a few justices to trample on the court’s reputation.

item.title: Middle East Crisis: More Than 800,000 Have Fled City in Gaza’s South, U.N. Official Says
item.description: People leaving Rafah since Israel’s military started to move in are crowding into other parts of Gaza, where they are lacking the most basic hygiene and infrastructure, the official said.

item.title: Scarlett Johansson says she's 'shocked, angered and in disbelief' over Sam Altman using a copycat voice for his new ChatGPT bot
item.description: OpenAI said it is “working to pause” Sky — the name of one of five voices that ChatGPT users can chose to speak with.

item.title: Has Fentanyl Peaked?
item.description: We explain a decline in overdose deaths.

item.title: Passenger Dies After Severe Turbulence on Singapore Airlines Flight
item.description: Several others were injured on the Singapore Airlines flight, which took off from Heathrow Airport in London on Monday, the airline said.

item.title: Biden and Trump united on heavy import tariffs as election approaches
item.description: Trump and Biden agree on essentially nothing else, from taxes and climate change to immigration and regulation.

item.title: Iran Begins Funeral Events for President Raisi
item.description: A procession in the city of Tabriz was the first in a string of events after Ebrahim Raisi’s death in a helicopter crash. Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has announced five days of mourning.

item.title: Iran Begins Funeral Events for President Raisi
item.description: A procession in the city of Tabriz was the first in a string of events after Ebrahim Raisi’s death in a helicopter crash. Iran’s supreme leader, Ayatollah Ali Khamenei, has announced five days of mourning.

item.title: Gen Zers walk into the workplace with one foot out the door—slandering them won’t solve the future-of-work conundrum
item.description: In a society where possibilities are endless, it shouldn’t come as a shock that there is an appeal in betting on yourself if your values are being ignored.

item.title: Haiti’s Gangs Grow Stronger as Kenyan-Led Force Prepares to Deploy
item.description: Gang leaders with suspected links to the 2021 Haitian president’s assassination now control key infrastructure, and pose a major threat to the incoming Kenya-led force.

item.title: Crowds Attend Funeral Procession for Iran’s President
item.description: Large numbers congregated in the northwestern city of Tabriz in a memorial event for Ebrahim Raisi and Hossein Amir Abdollahian, the country’s foreign minister, after both men died in a helicopter crash.

item.title: Trump’s Truth Social company lost more than $300 million in its first quarter as a public company
item.description: At this early stage in the Company’s development, TMTG remains focused on long-term product development, rather than quarterly revenue,” Trump Media said.

item.title: After Raisi’s Death, Elections Pose Tricky Test for Iran’s Rulers
item.description: Iran’s political establishment must choose between opening the race and facing moderate rivals, or limiting candidates and risking the embarrassment of low turnout.

item.title: Haiti’s Gangs Grow Stronger as Kenyan-Led Force Prepares to Deploy
item.description: Gang leaders with suspected links to the 2021 Haitian president’s assassination now control key infrastructure, and pose a major threat to the incoming Kenya-led force.

item.title: Drone pilots don't have First Amendment right to offer mapping services
item.description: The panel of the 4th U.S. Circuit Court of Appeals, in upholding a trial court’s decision, found the free-speech protections of Michael Jones and his 360 Virtual Drone Services business weren't violated.
